comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Harriot Eaton Stanton Blatch (January 20, 1856 – November 20, 1940) was a notable American writer and suffragist and the daughter of pioneering women's rights activist Elizabeth Cady Stanton. Source: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harriot_Eaton_Stanton_Blatch

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
Richard Arthur Norton:

Thanks for the information on Mrs. Blatch. Based on other images in the Prints and Photographs Division's collection, we can also identify the remaining women pictured here as, from L to R: Susan Fitzgerald, Emma Bugby, Maggie Murphy and Harriot Stanton Blatch.  We will expand the description when we update this record.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Other LOC photos of Harriot Blatch and associates in the New York suffrage parade: www.flickr.com/search/?q=Blatch&w=8623220@N02
